metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4354 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ber-decoder.c in Libksba before 1.3.3 uses an incorrect integer data type, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via crafted BER data, which leads to a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4354` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libksba8 - 1.3.0-3ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libksba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-3ubuntu0.14.04.2').
